instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1534: What is A1534? A1534 is a model number for a 12 inch size Macbook  from years 2015, 2016 with EMC 2746, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-00045, 820-00244..
definitions.820-00045: What is 820-00045? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1534</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00045</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a USB-C charger only works in one direction
threads.message:
Hello all,

This unit came to me with no power showing on the USB-C voltage meter, not even the 5v you normally see on these units. So ended up finding a bad power board DC jack. Replaced it.

Now it will start and charge just fine but will only charge with the charger cable in only one direction. Flip the charger cable and nothing. Will not even get 5v.

External monitor and usb doggles all work the same way. They work great in one direction but flip the cable adapter and nothing works.

No liquid damage seen at all. Very clean even. Not much dust at all.

Not sure what direction to go with this one. Thanks ahead for your help.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1534</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00045</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a USB-C charger only works in one direction
threads.message: Change <CHIP>U4700</CHIP>, as it fails a lot on these boards.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1534</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00045</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a USB-C charger only works in one direction
threads.message:
Right on! Of course.

Replaced <CHIP>U4700</CHIP> and now have power in both directions.

For those out there that might run into this, before I did what 2informaticos suggested, I wanted to eliminate any other capacitors causing the issue I was having. I check both <SIGNAL>E85_CC1</SIGNAL> and <SIGNAL>E85_CC2</SIGNAL> for either opens or short to ground via using diode mode coming out of <CHIP>U4700</CHIP>. I'm only guessing here, but since it says "bi" in the schematic I think that means bi-directional communication somehow getting back to the power adapter to turn on. Since I was only getting power in one direction.

And sure enough <SIGNAL>E85_CC1</SIGNAL> was shorted to ground. So to eliminate <CAPACITOR>C4706</CAPACITOR> capacitor, I removed it 1st before I replaced the <CHIP>U4700</CHIP>. Short was still there, and then removed <CHIP>U4700</CHIP> and double checked <SIGNAL>E85_CC1</SIGNAL> pin at the capacitor and the short was gone! Just like 2informaticos said. <CHIP>U4700</CHIP> was bad. I only had one of these in stock so I wanted to make sure I didn't fry a <CHIP>U4700</CHIP> chip. Time to order another one from Rossmann Group store!!

Thanks again for the information and help. I hope this will help someone else if needed!

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1534</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00045</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a USB-C charger only works in one direction
threads.message:
Glad to hear you solved it.

BTW, I didn't see you open the thread as new member, welcome to the forum!
